intro: Crotalaria alemanniana, commonly known as the German velvetflower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and distinctive yellow flowers with a spurred structure. It grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Crotalaria alemanniana is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial in soil enrichment.
